caption: One of the most beautiful museums to visit in Paris. It has a lot of wildlife on display. The museum has 4 floors and is phenomenal. If you have kids then you must bring them here. And come between 4-5pm in the evening so that it gets a bit dark and the lighting in the museum keeps changing so it's really beautiful. This museum has a completely different vibe.

This museum was a amazing surprised!  We were looking for a indoor museum for the kids during our visit to Paris because it was raining and we found this museum online.  We took our kids and we discovered such a fun and interesting place! The museum has a lot of animals and itâ€™s divided between the ocean or sea exhibition and and land animals.  They have beautiful galleries, a nice cafe and our entire family loved it.  The staff is super professional and friendly, they help us out with our luggage because we were in the run (they have lockers) and the experience was super positive.  100% recommended

Interesting and educational museum to explore. The taxidermy animals are well done and the informational plaques give content as you move through different biomes and then place humanity in the larger content of the world and how we interact with life around us. The only thing I would be interested in adding is information on where specific shells came from, although some animals (like the elephant) had this information available. Ground floor has a locker for bags. 1â‚¬ that you get back when done. There is also a cafe on the 01 floor with food and coffee.

Amazing place.. I learnt a lot about our planet .  My 8 year old was very excited to see all the different species. My husband was happy to explain about all the species to her.. It was his 2nd time visit so he knew about it before.., They were so excited ðŸ˜† and I was exhausted running behind them ..  I would say worth it for kids..

Museum is beautiful. Giant open space, not crowded. I had no headache as it was very comfortable air and noise level from people is minimal. Outdoor area was fabulous! But I removed star for little bits: 1. I had no idea about 1 coin needed for locker 2. Lifts were not working, but was okey with stairs 3. Make sure you have ear defenders if you or child scared of thunderstorms, interactive roof changes as weather - sun, rain, storm, sunrise etc. and my kid were a bit overwhelmed, but some other kids were very scared. I shared my headphones so little boy could calm down while it finished

Visited in December, during the week. Although the exhibits were beautiful, they were missing explanations in other languages (at least english should be available, not everyone speaks french). The museum looked kind of old on the inside. Also there were many students drawing the exhibits on the ground floor, which can be annoying when you want to have a look at something and you need to pay attention not to step on someone or something. Tried to leave a review at the exit, but again, menu available only in french :)

Amazing Museum , a Must see if you are in Paris , take the kids with you , they will love it! Large gardens between the buildings , a typical carrossel outside for the kids. Only downside is there is no info in English or ear pods with all the languages on the exhibits .. everything is in French.
One of my favorite museum in Paris, you can see smth thatâ€™s static, dynamic and a VR show if you do the reservation for it (not regular, need to search in advance)
Amazing place if you are nature lover! You can spend 2/3 hours in here. There are plenty of animals and the atmosphere is magical! It is very kid friendly

I've been to this park before and fell in love with the trees and flowers there, but this was my first time in this museum (they have another museum on the other side of the park). I'm fascinated by butterflies and seashells and marine life. Sometimes the lights change color to resemble night time so it's a bit dark and hard to see, but this is a very beautiful museum.

A must visit if you like natural sciences and paleontology. Specially if you are travelling with kids, they will love it. It's situated in a beautiful garden which you can enter without tickets. From there you can go to different exhibitions and get their tickets at the entrance to their buildings, or simply enjoy the gardens which are beautiful on their own.

For parents with children on a city break in Paris this is a MUST!  One of the best things I have been to in any city.  It might be blasphemous to say (as a Londoner) but this could be better than the NHM in London
We had a great time visiting this museum, there were lots of figures of animals up for display with some information, although it could've been more, such as the dates, quantity, etc.

Unbelievable! No signs in English! Not even a single word. Just a bunch of animals with non precise order among them. Too little information about evolution or the way it happened. Thank god I didnâ€™t pay to enter (under 26). I would only recommend it for children to see how some animals looked like. Not worth it, sorry but have seen way better.

The Felines Exhibit was detailed with some of the best taxidermy Iâ€™ve seen in my life. We were able to witness a live theatrical performance that moved me literally to tears. The museum focuses heavily on how humans are negatively impacting our planet. There are tons of interactive exhibits to keep the little ones entertained. They even have virtual reality!

The National Museum of Natural History in Paris is a place that truly transports you to another time and world. Despite the fact that the exhibits feature "stuffed" animals, the experience feels so alive and immersive. Itâ€™s not just about seeing the animals; it's about feeling connected to the natural world and the history they represent.  The museum is beautifully curated, with impressive displays that captivate both adults and children alike. My family and I love coming hereâ€”every visit feels like an adventure, sparking curiosity and wonder. Whether you're gazing at the majestic skeletons or walking through the rich botanical gardens, thereâ€™s always something to discover.  It's a place that allows you to step out of the present and into the past, while still feeling entirely relevant to todayâ€™s world. If you have any interest in nature, science, or history, this museum is a must-visit!

An incredible journey through evolution!!! It's also very interesting for kids!!! They can see the different animals in their size and evolution!!! The whale skeletons are stunning!!! Most interesting, the roof disconnects from the light outside. Hence different times of the day or weather situations change within one hour!!!

It would be a crime to give anything less than 5 stars. Firstly, I entered the museum for free with a Student card. The museum and exhibits were excellent- well maintained, very wide scope of specimens and very well displayed. Compared to some of the other museums with fossils on display, this one is undoubtedly one of the best I've had the privilege of visiting. The dinosaur fossil specimens are EXCELLENT. Very fine specimens, and the aide of natural sunlight really helps to display them brilliantly. Very impressed.

spend 1~2 hours to go there! Cheap tickets fee and many local to go there at saturday! the decoration is great and the animals are so real. Sadly not all of the info of animals with eng version. Many local students paint here. u can feel the atmosphere of art in paris.

It is a very large collections of bones and some replicas. Each floor is dedicated to specific periods of time. This building is my classic image of a museum but I felt overwelmed by the amount of pieces, also the place it is clean but I felt like maintenance is missing. As foreing itâ€™s sad donâ€™t have text in other languages than french.
i absolutely love this museum. the exhibits are informative and timely and the main hall of mammals is absolutely breathtaking. highly recommend!  itâ€™s also free for those under 26 :)

What an incredibly interesting museum! It holds fossilised plants, creatures, and critters from over 200 million years ago to the organs of more recent mammals and reptiles across its three floors. The sheer amount of specimens that can be observed here is remarkable and fascinating, a good few hours would need to be set aside to look at all of these in great detail which is perfect for return trips to the French capital.  Moreover, the museum is free to anyone under 25 and fairly cheap prices for anyone else. Itâ€™s simply a great visit to experience if in the area.

Beautiful museum. You will think you have stepped into Jules Verne's secret Laboratory as soon as you enter the grand hall.  The exhibits arranged nicely with ocean life in the basement going up to land mammals on the ground floor then birds and monkeys on the upper levels.  the museum is also surrounded by a gorgeous Park that you should take some time and explore.  I highly recommend this for something off the beaten path for when you're in Paris.

A museum that enables you to trace the evolution of man and the animal kingdom and their impact on our planet. It is rich in information and specimens that can be discovered, and it left us speechless because of its beauty and the abundance of things that can be seen and discovered, fossils, dinosaur skeletons, and creatures that you would not believe lived millions of years ago on the planet.  I highly recommend this museum to those who want to discover and learn where we come from!

You are not welcome if you dont speak french.  Booking platform: Tickets sell out quickly while place is really not crowded inside. Confusing system. Unclear. Slow. Requires creating an account and registration!  Inside: Just a Waste of money I paid 13â‚¬ to see hundreds of plastic figurines of animals. I expected some real fossils or skeletons. Instead, Just plastic figures with french signs and explanations. Even interactive screens are in french only. Video shows are french only. If this exhibition was anywhere else in the world, it would offer at least 3 languages. Not in great france though. if you dont speak french then go somewhere else you are not welcome in paris.
It was a really hot day in paris so we spontaneously decided to cool down a bit inside the museum and it was a great ideaâ€¦ the kids enjoyed it a lot and we got to cool down from the heat waveâ€¦

Extremely disappointing experience. The Museum is a large open building, but the  exhibits are crammed into the middle in eerie rows and are mostly reproductions of current day animals, not ice age or older fossils of extinct animals. Furthermore, I am both disabled AND a staff member of the Los Angeles Museum of Natural History, but they required me to pay to enter! Unbelievable. No reciprocity, and no respect. This was the only Museum in all of Paris that asked me to pay for my ticket, which should have been free. Avoid this place, which is a sad and very poorly done display of current day animals and a disgrace to the science of natural history. I would give them a minus 5-star review if I could. NOT WORTH THE WHILE OR THE MONEY!!!

Beautiful museum with a great collection housed in a spectacular building. Support for information in languages other than French is not provided at any of the exhibits and lighting is low so reading many information plaques is difficult anyway. Otherwise, a very worthwhile stop. Plan a good 2-3 hours to cover the ground.
Despite the fact that the museum was pretty and had lots of exhibitions the fact that there was no sign in English and only in French made the experience unbearable
Cool place. Looks awesome but can get busy

I went there with my 5 yo kid. He was excited about all the animals and sceletons for sure but floors 2-4 have less to offer kids as the building overall is very dark and one can barely see insects and smaller animals. Some screens offered interactive games which were fun but not many. No lines. Cheap. Tickets were 10Eur total for both of us. We spent 2 hours there.
Great for the kids, spend a couple hours here. A little dark and descriptions are all in french. The exhibits are entertaining.

I am so glad I went and was able to experience first hand history. Wow. Move aside Jurassic Park, this place is the real deal. I loved it here. It felt like a secret gem that no one else knew about. You could easily spend the day here and around the grounds.

I truly liked the museum. A great place if you have kids or you like natural sciences.  You will find some interactive screens to play and learn. The museum is big, but there is a cafe in the second floor if you are looking for a break.  My recommendation is to focus on the sections that you have more interest. Sadly, some sections are not in English.

The MusÃ©um National d'Histoire Naturelle is a fascinating museum that explores the natural world through its extensive collections of fossils, minerals, plants, and animal specimens. Located in the beautiful Jardin des Plantes, itâ€™s a perfect place for anyone interested in science and nature. The museum features engaging exhibits that span from prehistoric times to modern-day biodiversity, making it educational for visitors of all ages. With its impressive galleries and peaceful garden surroundings, itâ€™s a great spot to learn and enjoy the wonders of the natural world in Paris.
Beautiful grounds, transition from outside, to inside, then back outside again. Take your time to stroll around and discover so many fun experiences!
A great visit, set amongst so beautiful gardens. If your in Paris for 3+ days then I would add this to your list. Nice to break up our trip to Paris with some history.
The geology museum is simply stunning - my 7 year old nature lover was in awe. We could have spent the day touring the grounds and buildings.  It is a must see for all ages!
